agave
Interface InstanceCreator

All Known Implementing Classes:
ReflectionInstanceCreator
public interface InstanceCreator

Creates instances of handlers and forms for use by the AgaveFilter. The default implementation of this is ReflectionInstanceCreator, but you can override it by specifying an initialization param to the AgaveFilter. An example of this is: 

<web-app>
 ...
 <filter>
   <filter-name>AgaveFilter</filter-name>
   <filter-class>agave.AgaveFilter</filter-class>
   <init-param>
     <param-name>instanceCreator</param-name>
     <param-value>com.domain.package.DefaultInstanceFactory</param-value>
   </init-param>
 </filter>
 ...
 </web-app>
Note that only a single value is supported, so there is no way to have multiple LifecycleHookss, unless the value named by the parameter fronts multiple others. This is intentional, and was designed to be this way so that the conceptual overhead of using Agave is shallow.

Author:
Damian Carrillo

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object createFormInstance(HandlerDescriptor descriptor)
          Creates instances of form objects.
 java.lang.Object createHandlerInstance(HandlerDescriptor descriptor)
          Creates instances of handler objects.
 void initialize()
          Initializes this InstanceCreator if necessary.
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize()
Initializes this InstanceCreator if necessary. This method is called in the AgaveFilter.init(javax.servlet.FilterConfig) method, so it is an effective way to set up a mechanism for providing dependency injection or hooking into an IOC library.

createFormInstance

java.lang.Object createFormInstance(HandlerDescriptor descriptor)
                                    throws FormException
Creates instances of form objects.

Parameters:
descriptor - The HandlerDescriptor of the request handler the form object is being created for
Returns:
an instance of the described form class
Throws:
FormException - if construction fails

createHandlerInstance

java.lang.Object createHandlerInstance(HandlerDescriptor descriptor)
                                       throws HandlerException
Creates instances of handler objects.

Parameters:
descriptor - The HandlerDescriptor that describes the request handler
Returns:
an instance of the described request handler
Throws:
HandlerException - if construction fails
